name: A Williamsburg White House Bed and Breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I were approaching our 25th anniversary, and we decided to celebrate by visiting Colonial Williamsburg. We had been researching a place to stay near by the Historic village. Having never had the experience of staying in a Bed and Breakfast, we decided to try it out. We had googled and found A Williamsburg White House Bed and Breakfast. We loved the whole idea of the coziness of a B & B, picking out our room, being with in walking distance of Historic Williamsburg , and having breakfast provided for us! Upon arriving we immediately fell in love, the house was decorated for Christmas and looked so cozy. We were greeted by the inn keeper, he was very friendly and welcoming. We stayed in the Lincoln room. The king size bed was very comfortable, loved the separate bathrooms, and loved the area that was to resemblethe Ford Theater! The breakfasts were not only delicious but very filling. We never eat such large breakfasts! I liked knowing what was on the menu the night before. The Inn keepers were very prompt on serving breakfast, that way we could eat and get on with our day! We loved meeting other couples, many were from other parts of the country. We enjoyed the social aspect of breakfast, sitting in the dinning room together. It was a very nice way to get aquainted with the house guests! The Inn keepers were very warm, welcoming and helpful, answering any questions we might have. This was a wonderful experience for us. We would love to come back, next time we would love to bring our adult children and their spouses!! Thank you John and Deb for a wonderful time!!
reviews.title: A warm and cozy retreat!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The B&B was very nice but there was not the normal warm and welcoming experience that we expect when staying at a B&B. The owners were welcoming but not interactive with the guests. The whole process of selecting your breakfast entree the night previous with a threat of no breakfast if the menu was not turned in was a little off putting. Our room was very clean but the heat could not be adjusted so our room was very warm for our liking at night. The B&B is very close to town and the college so its location is excellent.
reviews.title: Average experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I recently stayed at A Williamsburg White House B&B as we traveled from Texas to Virginia, Connecticut, Missouri and back to Texas. On the way to Virginia we realized we had miscalculated our time. When we called and spoke with Debbie explaining our mistake asking if there was any way we could shift our time forward a day she said...'done'. That was the beginning of our wonderful stay at this beautiful Inn. We had selected the FDR Chamber which is separate from the main house. It was a beautiful, spacious room with a king sized bed, huge bathroom and plenty of privacy. Breakfasts were thoughtfully prepared and presented...and delicious. We did NOT need lunch! Each evening wine and yummy baked goodies were available to enjoy. The Inn is located across from the beautiful campus of The College of William and Mary. John and Debbie are gracious hosts with a great sense of humor and a lot of fun. They are available whenever you might need them as they live on the premises, which is a real plus. There is a huge library should you want to read, but with so much to see and do there was no time. Colonial Williamsburg and the surrounding area is rich in history and a very short distance away. Everyone should visit this important city. The re-enactments held each afternoon were a highlight. We had such a short amount of time to take it all in and sadly were not able to do so. We told our friends in CT and discussed taking another trip and meeting up at the 'White House'. There is no other place we would want to stay and now look forward to going back. We highly recommend this beautiful B&B!!
reviews.title: A Beautiful Retreat

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Bill and Bonnie Waxahachie, TX
reviews.title: A wonderful way to visit Williamsburg

reviews.text: This was our first visit to Williamsburg and what a delightful introduction it was. The signs in the parking lot were an indication of the whimsical way Debbie and John Keane run the Inn. We parked in the "Press Corps" slot, our hint that all things White House were in store, and we were not disappointed. We stayed in the Lincoln Suite, with dual bathrooms, and everything was spot on. Breakfasts were hearty and the conversation lively, just what we would expect. Tons of interesting memorabilia and a well stocked library just added to the charm. We'll be back, even though it's a long haul from Nashville
reviews.title: Incomparable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Williamsburg White House has an excellent location for a pedestrian visit of the old town, as well as for a driving visit to Jamestown andYorktown. Our arrival found the door locked and the hosts unavailable until 3pm ( we waited 15 minutes on a bench outside in the gardens). Not the best start! Our room, the FDR, was in the west wing addition, and had separate entrance and considerable privacy. The room was in keeping with the house and area,was comfortable,spacious, and had a nice king sleigh bed that was very comfortable. Lighting was dim. The bathroom was functional but could have used improvements. Birds sang outside our window every morning-delightful! The house is located one kilometre from the start of the old town,and it is a very plasant stroll down the street with the William and MaryCollege to get there. The public rooms of the house were graciously decorated in vibrant colours accented with white and were quite charming. The hosts,a couple running the place for 12 years,were efficient but somewhat standoffish and inflexible. For example, on returning from an evening out and being tired from a long day, we were already undressed and on the bed when we looke at the sheet for a breakfast order. It stated that if we did not return it that night it would be assumed we did not want breakfastTthat is unacceptable for hosts of a B&B. Next morning the gentleman \john grumbled about it, but still gave us breaskfast,though no attempt was made to accommodate the slightest variation on what he had planned. In fact, while the bed part of the deal was charming and most welcome, the breakfast part was far wide of the mark on several fronts. The lady of the house redeemed them our last morning when( having been told on arrival that breakfast was at 9am and earlier did not exist) she provided an excellent breakfast as we had asked from her and had it ready at 7am !). Overall I would recommend this B&B withoiut hesitation, but-as so often with B&Bs- feel the hosts need to be more relaxed,less stuffy and more flexible. Guests are on holiday.....please remember that!
reviews.title: characteristic base for the area

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The White House Bed and Breakfast in Williamsburg was a wonderful experience for my husband and I. It was our first time staying in Williamsburg, and we will indeed be back to stay again. The owners are gracious, inviting, wonderful people. We slept like babies, and woke to a hearty, scrumptious breakfast each morning that will keep you fully-energized for all the walking. You are within a short half mile walk to all of Colonial Williamsburg, and directly across the street from the campus of William & Mary.
reviews.title: A charming presidential bed and breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Lincoln Room, which is spot on with the previous reviews, is clean, spacious, charming, his and hers bathroom, and a king size bed. The Presidential theme throughout the entire house is so much fun and so well thought out down to the details; my husband loved reading in the JFK Library. The goodies and port in the evening is a special treat. After a day of walking and touring, it felt so good to put the feet up and enjoy a glass of wine with cookies in their charming red room before dinner.
reviews.title: Excellent Romantic Getaway!

reviews.text: I cannot imagine choosing another bed and breakfast in Williamsburg. Sleeping within Presidential history, and touring the day in colonial history, will give you a most memorable experience. We will be back!
reviews.title: A four day stay at the Williamsburg White House

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The White House in Williamsburg was a fantastic experience for me and my wife. We received very thoughtful service throughout our stay. For example, I was served superb gluten free waffles despite giving the hosts quite short notice of my allergy. The Lincoln room, where we stayed, was spacious and very comfortable. The afternoon wine and baked treats was also a highlight. Overall, it was quiet, clean, and cozy with excellent service, food, and location.
reviews.title: Highly Recommend!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We're madly in love with the Inn and the fireplace and the music and the breakfasts and the afternoon wine and cookies and the innkeepers John and Debbie and the decor and the parking signs and I could go on and on. After 9 visits the Inn feels like home away from home for us. We've met folks at breakfast from all parts of the country and enjoy our morning chats before our relaxing days spent shopping and sightseeing and our evenings spent fireside. The Inn meets all of our needs and we're already looking forward to visit 10!
reviews.title: 9 Visits - More to Come

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a gift certificate for it and, having never stayed at a B&B before, we were a tad apprehensive. Visions of Petticoat Junction, parlor games, and one bathroom for the the population in general sprang to mind. We steeled ourselves for stuffiness and fake Tiffany floor lamps. This was NOT the case. The proprietors were delightful, the room was immaculate (private bath!) and the breakfasts were well worth it. I don't know about it being especially political, except for the signs on the parking spots, but with a name like "White House Inn" you have to expect something on that order. Ergo the name. We will be back.
reviews.title: Pleasant surprise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If your idea of a get-away is a Republican National Committee Meeting, than this is the place for you! The inn is lovely, immaculately clean and serves a good breakfast but I wish I had known the name "White House" referred to the innkeepers political views, not the exterior color of the inn. We were greeted by the innkeeper with, "I noticed you didn't park in the parking space marked Republican" and "Say whatever you like while your here, we don't believe in political correctness". The common area was decorated with pictures of Republican high-lights and Democrat low-lights. We especially thought the framed picture of Monica Lewinsky was in poor taste. This has nothing to do with our political affiliations, I am a registered Independent and my husband is a registered Republican. We both feel you do not discuss politics in polite company, especially if you are in the service industry. And we always try to leave the troubles of the world behind us when we travel. It's a shame that this was our first and last impression of the inn because, otherwise, we thought the inn was lovely.
reviews.title: Too political

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: During our 41 years of marriage we have been to Colonial Williamsburg 2 times with our son,once during Spring Vacation and once for the summer vacation,but each time just stayed in a hotel.My husband and I always talked about seeing the sites at Christmas time and decided this would be the year.I searched the internet for a place to stay and was impressed with the package deal and the pictures of A White House B&B.We had never stayed in one before, but our first experience was wonderful.The pictures were true,the inn keepers were extremely friendly,breakfasts were delicious and we met interesting, social people who also made us feel comfortable.We both agreed "let's do this again".
reviews.title: 41 years later

reviews.text: I selected The White House from the internet website in Oct/Nov. 2011. The pictures of how this B&B is decorated at Christmastime really drew me in--in reality it was even more beautiful and cozy and tastefully decorated (the only thing missing was the snow!) than in the pictures! It is set back from the street and both exterior and interior are aglow with Christmas lights and greenery. From the exquisite, white-lit, red-ribboned tree in the living room to the boughs and lights adorning the banisters, I knew I had made a great choice! Once inside, we were offered a late afternoon sampling of cookies, sweets, and a variety of wines and sherrys set out for all the guests. We stayed in the "Washington" room (all rooms are themed with a President's name) and were my hubby and teenage son ever pleased to find a TV in the suite! The room was decorated colonial-style with portraits of George Washington. The bed was SO comfortable, with a scrumptious, warm, plump, white comforter on top-- it made it harder to get up in the a.m.! The breakfasts are made to order and so RICH - eggs benedict, stuffed french toast, belgian waffles - delicious, although I may have preferred perhaps a lower-calorie option! Two mornings we ate in an elegant, stately library and the third morning we sat in the main dining room, where you can chat with the other houseguests at a beautiful, long dining table.
reviews.title: Absolutely glowing at Christmas

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was shocked to read the few negative reviews of the Whitehouse in Williamsburg, Virginia. From what planet do these people come?
reviews.title: à Wholly Charming B & B

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent six (6) welcoming and friendly nights at the Whitehouse. We arrived a bit late, but were greeted by John Keane who immediately helped us with the several bags that we carrying. (It took two trips, but John was there for it all!). We were given a short tour, shown how to use the two keys that we were given, offered a glass of wine and left to settle in.
reviews.title: Memorable stay while in Williamsburg

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our stay was idyllic. We had done a lot of driving to get toWilliamsburg, so got up later than the 8:30 AM breakfast call. Debbie was most helpful in recommending a lovely restaurant in the center of town for breakfast. It was very good.
reviews.title: Great R&R for military

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Both Debbie and John patiently answered our many questions about touring Williamsburg, Yorktown and Jamestown. Debbie recommended several very good restaurants and made our reservations for each. She described the route to each … each night.
reviews.title: Awful place
Things not to do at the White House
reviews.text: The breakfasts were feasts. Hot coffee and tea awaited the early risers. The menu changed each morning with each day being more inventive and tasty that the previous one. We have come from a family reunion and were satiated with conversation. On our second day, we requested breakfast in the room off of the living room and arrived to find a beautifully set table with hot coffee, fresh fruit and hot water for tea. John was our gracious server.

aka: a Williamsburg White House Hotel Williamsburg
description: This Historic Century Old Estate is now an Award Winning Bed and Breakfast in Williamsburg Virginia. This Romantic Inn is one of Williamsburg's most significant historic homes and is the oldest home currently operating as an elegant B&B in the City of Williamsburg. Enjoy unique suites, beautiful sitting rooms, manicured grounds and just a 4 block walk to Colonial Williamsburg. Historic and Romance Packages available.
